techmeme.title: Sources: investigators suspect Chinese ship Yi Peng 3 dragged its anchor for 100+ miles to sever two Baltic internet cables, possibly at the behest of Russia (Bojan Pancevski/Wall Street Journal)
Sony says it has sold 160M+ PlayStation 2 consoles globally since its 2000 launch, the highest-selling console of all time ahead of the Nintendo DS and Switch (Alex Stedman/IGN)
Italy, Europol, and others say they dismantled a pirate streaming service that redistributed IPTV, Sky, and more, served 22M+ users, and made €250M per month (Bill Toulas/BleepingComputer)
Analysis: Elon Musk posted about Trump's cabinet picks 70+ times from November 7 to 20 to promote his preferred candidates; Trump picked others in several cases (Reuters)
US police in California, Colorado, and Indiana are testing Draft One, Axon's AI tool that generates police reports from Axon's bodycam audio, with 75 officers (Barbara Booth/CNBC)
